data.title: 11 best countries for solo travel in 2023
data.meta_description: Explore the world on your terms, at your own pace, and without the constraints of group travel. Here's some perfect destinations to start.
data.text:
Solo travel has become increasingly popular over the years, as more people seek to explore the world on their own terms, at their own pace, and without the constraints of group travel.

Not only can you have complete control over your itinerary, budget, and experiences, but solo travel can also be a great way to learn about new cultures, meet new people, and challenge yourself in new ways. It can be daunting for some, but with careful planning and preparation, solo travel can be a rewarding and life-changing experience.

Whether you’re a first-timer at solo travelling or an experienced solo traveller looking for new destinations, check out some of these countries that are best for solo travel this year.

1. Indonesia

Indonesia is a diverse archipelago country composed of more than 17,000 islands. In terms of solo travel, the best island is none other than Bali, which offers an abundance of experiences, including water sports, nature, wellness and spiritual activities.

Bali is a popular location for digital nomads, especially the Canggu area, due to its laid-back atmosphere and co-working spaces. Other areas to consider include the artistic Ubud and the luxurious Seminyak, making Bali an excellent destination for solo travellers looking to explore, relax, and connect with the local community.

Related: 10 best adventures and places to visit in Bali for nature lovers

Bali travel: things to do and where to stay in Seminyak

6 must-do activities in Ubud, Bali in 2023

Nusa Penida Day Tour with Optional Snorkelling from Bali, from S$47.55 (was S$52.79)

Book a spot on the tour here

Uluwatu Kecak Fire and Dance Show Ticket in Bali, S$12.89

Get tickets here

2. Thailand

Thailand is an ideal destination for solo travelling, thanks to its friendly locals, vibrant culture, scrumptious food, and stunning natural beauty. Travelling alone in Thailand can be a safe and rewarding experience, with plenty of opportunities to explore the country's many attractions at your own pace—not forgetting shopping, of course! Besides, its affordable accommodation makes Thailand a great option for solo travellers on a budget.

Let's Relax Spa Experience in Chiang Mai, from S$24.49 (was S$25.45)

Book massage here

SEA LIFE Bangkok Ocean World Ticket, from S$45.49 (was S$50.55)

Get tickets here

3. Vietnam

Vietnam offers a wide range of activities and experiences for solo travellers. From bustling cities to pristine beaches, lush greenery to stunning mountain ranges, Vietnam has it all. Whether you’re into its rich culture and history, or enjoy outdoor adventures and its delicious cuisine, Vietnam will never make you feel bored travelling alone.

Specifically, in the traditional villages in Sapa, you can immerse yourself in their way of life, and learn about their customs, traditions, and daily routines. Otherwise, you can experience the Vietnamese city life in its capital, Hanoi.

Sun World Ba Na Hills Ticket in Da Nang, from S$44.65 (was S$45.25)

Get tickets here

Sun World Fansipan Legend Ticket in Vietnam, from S$37.89 (was S$38.45)

Get tickets here

4. Japan

Japan is a unique and fascinating country that offers a wealth of experiences for solo travellers. From high-tech gadgets and anime culture to serene gardens and ancient temples and shrines to mouth-watering food and amazing landscapes, there are many Japanese cities — Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, Kanazawa, Hiroshima, Okinawa, Sapporo, etc. — to choose from for solo travel.

Japan is also generally safe for solo travellers, with low crime rates and efficient public transportation. The locals are also known for their politeness and helpfulness, making it easy for solo travellers to navigate their way around the country.

Mt Fuji Classic Route Day Tour from Tokyo, S$70.15

Get tickets here

Nagasaki Huis Ten Bosch Ticket, from S$50.15

Get tickets here

5. South Korea

With a unique mix of tradition and innovation, South Korea lets solo travellers explore its rich history and culture, on top of its delicious cuisine and picturesque views. Additional cookie points to make South Korea your next solo travel destination if you’re looking to improve your Korean language skills. Similar to Japan, South Korea is generally a safe country for solo travellers, with low crime rates and efficient public transportation.

Nami Island / Petite France / Garden of Morning Calm / Rail Bike / Alpaca World / Legoland, from S$60.95

Get tickets here

Haslla Art World Ticket, S$8.15 (was S$11.05)

Get tickets here

6. Australia

Australia is a popular destination for solo travellers, thanks to its impressive landscapes, a wide range of adventures and friendly culture. You can also connect easily with the locals and make new friends, with many hostels, tour groups, and social events available for solo travellers. Unlike the previous countries mentioned, not having a language barrier in Australia is a huge plus point!

Blue Mountains Scenic World Ticket, from S$48.59

Get tickets here

Phillip Island Nature Parks Penguin Parade Ticket, from S$26.99

Get tickets here

7. New Zealand

New Zealand is a great location for solo travellers to marvel at breathtaking landscapes and learn about unique culture, traditions and history. Best of all, it is the place to go for adventurous activities, including bungee jumping, skydiving, and hiking on some of the world's most beautiful trails. It is also easy to connect with the friendly locals without the language barrier.

Shotover Jet Boat Ride in Queenstown, S$120.49

Get tickets here

Agrodome Farm Show and Tour Ticket in Rotorua, S$32.85

Get tickets here

8. United States

The United States is a vast and diverse country with a wide range of experiences to offer solo travellers. Be it the bustling cities of New York and Los Angeles, or the natural wonders of the Grand Canyon and Yellowstone National Park, there is something for everyone. Apart from learning the country's rich history and culture, you can also explore outdoor activities ranging from hiking and skiing to surfing and camping.

Top of the Rock Ticket in New York, S$57.85

Get tickets here

Yosemite Day Tour from San Francisco, S$263.55

Book tour here

9. Canada

Canada offers solo travellers vast wilderness areas, including towering mountains, pristine lakes, and lush forests. Besides taking part in outdoor activities like skiing, snowboarding, hiking, and kayaking, you can also experience its rich culture and history, from its indigenous peoples to its modern-day multicultural cities. Likewise, the lack of a language barrier makes it easy to navigate around.

Lake Louise, Banff & Yoho National Park Day Tour from Calgary, S$135.59

Book tour here

1 Day Bad Land & Dinosaur Museum Tour, S$133.65

Book tour here

10. Spain

Spain is a popular destination for solo travellers, offering a rich history, culture, and cuisine. For outdoor enthusiasts, Spain has a range of activities, such as hiking in the Pyrenees Mountains, surfing on the Basque Coast, and skiing in the Sierra Nevada. The country's vibrant cities, including Barcelona, Madrid, and Seville, have unique character and charm, making Spain a memorable solo travel destination.

Sagrada Familia Ticket in Barcelona, from S$49.35

Get tickets here

Toledo and Segovia from Madrid, S$103.75

Get tickets here

11. Iceland

Iceland is a unique destination for solo travellers, offering a landscape unlike anywhere else in the world. Not only can you explore Iceland's rugged terrain, including its glaciers, geysers, and volcanoes, but you can also soak in its natural hot springs, hike its many trails, and go whale watching in its surrounding seas.

Iceland is famous for its spectacular scenery, including the Northern Lights, which are visible in the winter months. Iceland makes an excellent destination for solo travellers looking for adventure, nature, and unforgettable experiences in a breathtakingly beautiful environment.

Golden Circle Tour and Kerid Crater Day Tour, from S$83.45

Don't miss this tour

Jokulsarlon Glacier Lagoon and South Coast Day Trip, from S$207.95

Book day trip here
